page.title: 02FORESTRY IN THE WYE VALLEY
page.content: Most of the woodlands in the lower Wye valley area are owned and managed by the Forestry Commission.The Commis- ion are responsible for the harvesting and replanting of their plantations. The woodlands in the area are a mix- ture of broadleaved and coniferous trees.The Commission sometimes plants them together to add variety and for conservation and timber production. Great care is taken not to alter the character of the woodlands.In the area they have provided picnic sites and trails for the many visitors.One picnic site near Cleddon Falls has had to be abandoned because of the invasion of giant ants. Whatever time of the year you visit the woodlands the views are dramatic and colourful,autumn is part- cularly spectacular because of the contrasting mixture of foliage.
